TO.WHOLESALE BUYERS’ 8 TORE-KEEPER 3, AND OTHER TRADERS. —If you are not ft reader of “Afrioan Com- merce,” the British Trade Medium for All Africa, send 7d. for a copy to The Manager, “African Commerce," Tower Chambf rs, Moorgate Street, London, fE.C. Annual Subscription 7/6-post free.
el Bassal near the Gabbari Goods Station and on the Bank of the Mahmoudieh Canal will be offered for sale by public auction at the Governorate of Alexandria on May 25th 1905 between the hours of 9 a.m. and noon. The building occupiea an area of over 13,000 aq. metres.
The upset price for the land and buildings is The building is open to inspection by the' Publio every day from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. Plans and specifications may be seen at the Ministry of Finance, Government Linds Offioe, or_at thp-Go.vernorate of Alexandria. Tor further information apply to H.E. the Governor of Alexandria. 25950-6-3
AVIS La Municipality met en adjudication las travaux de macadamisage do la route d’Aboukir du Bazar de Biods k la Scation Gabrial. Le oautiounemeut est fixk k L.E. 100 (Cent). Le cabier des oharges est d$pos6 aq bureau dola Vpirie oh il pout ifttre oousultd par lea intyress6s tons les jours do 9 h.k middles jours f6ri6a excepWs.
Les off res dovront fltro adrossdos sous pli ca- chets k Monsieur l’Administratour de la Muni- cipality avant le 30 Mai 1905. EUes pourront dgalement fltro ddposdes en sdance de la Ddldgation le mflme jour k 5h.p.m. , L’enveloppe devra portor^.eq.outrp la men- tion 1 v ^0omission ponr maoulaiilisage route d’Aboukir.
Le cautionnement ou le requ d’une Banque, d’aprks los conditions du oahiey des oharges, devra «tre remis sdpardment au Sotvioo de la ComptabiUtd Gdudrale avant l’ouverture dos offres et au plus tard le 30 Mai k midi. Toute offre qui no remplit pas les conditions oi-dessus sera doartde. Alexandria, le 16 Mai 1905. 26978-a i

POSTS AND TELEGRAPHS DEPARTMENT. NOTICE. Tenders will be reooivedat the Office of tho Director of Posts and Telegraphs, Khartoum, up to 12 noon on Thursday the 1st Jane 1905 for the parobase of the following Postage Stamps:— (defaced)
Sodjui PosUsn Sumps facs rains about BE. MO. MO mlm Egyptian.......... „ „ 1100. WO m'm Foreign „ _ ,, „ .........too. 000 mlm Persons wi^Hin^ to tender can consult the 8peoifioation aftue above Offioei any day' from 9 a. m. to 1 p. m. except Fridays and General Holidays.
Tenders must be submitted on stamped pa- per : they should be addressed to tbii Direotor of Posts and Telegraphs, in a sealed envelope bearing the inscription “Tenders for purchase of Obliterated Sudan Postage Stamps.’’ The above Sudan Stamps can also be ob- tained in complete sets at the rate of 50 'm/m a sot bat not less than four sets can be sold.' The Director of Posts and Telegraphs does not bind himself to accept the highest or any’ tender. (Signed) H. L. Mackworth, Bimb., K A. Asst-Direotor of Posts and Telegraphs. Khartoum, 6th April 1905. 25816-15x10

The issue is Heitig‘m4de simultaneously Ih'EtgltlM 4nd in Egypt The subscription lists will open on Thursday, tho 18th of May, and close on or before Friday, the 19th of May, 1905. A Prospectus has been Filed with tho Registrar of Joint Stock Companie s which among other things i say :— North Egypt Lai)d Coy.
LIMITED. (Incorporated under the Companies Acts, 1862 to 1900). CAPITAL . . . £230,000, Divided into 230,000 Shares of £1 each. Present Issue ......................... 100,000 Shares The Vendor stipulates for the allot- ment to himself of 80,0t)0 Shares in part payment of the purchase consi- deration .............................. 80,000' „ Held in reserve .................. 100.000 30.000 100.000 230,000 The proceeds of 30,000 Shares of this Issue win be set apart for Working da] (subject to payment of the preliminary expenses estimated at £2,000), Subsoriptiirs are now invited for 100,000 Shares ai par, PAYABLE BI- o* Application, 51- on Allotment,
The balance of 10/- one month after Allotment ^ he subscription upon which the Directors will allot being 100 000 Shares, and the Subscription of these 100,000 Shares havin'g been gua - ranteed, the Board will proceed to Allotment on the closing of the Lists. Subscribers may, on payment in fuU of the Shares allotted to them, receive Share Warrants to Bearer iu respect of such allotmeh.ts if desired. Directors.

THIS Company has been formed for the purposes - set oat in iU Memorandum of Association,, and m Parrioulax to ^irej uiiaer tho oUntraot referred to, and to oultivate kd# “dAkl ^vhttf the Freehold Estate, about 14,500’ foddantf (about 15,000 acres, equal to 6,092 hectares or 245 square miles) situate at Hommam,■ iu the distriotof Mariout, m-. Bgyyt, i being a portion of ithfe estate of H.H. the Khedive of Egypt The property has beda reported' upon by Messrs.! Sir ^ Douglas Fox and Partners, Consulting„Engineers of the Company and the conclusion of their Report to the Di- rectors, dated 26th January, 1905, U as > follows
Taking a broad view of the whole matter, we feel that we can recommend the property, ana that with, a canal constructed and given sufficient water, your Company formed to acquire and work the Estate, should prove a success. Aooqmpsureing.. the. Report from which the above extracts are made are .calcula- tions made .for. Mewra, 8ir Dquglaa Fox and Partners by Mr. Alchevaky, Ingenior Agronome, as to"the. quantity of water required to irrigate the Estate and the various ■crojjs'pef feddan1' whicnu8h6uld' ba 'prodliced therefrom, and the oonolusion of those eirabfotBs irthkV'When'th^ whole of’the area is undef oulllvation tho orops will pro- duoe, as H tofrfmmn"estimate, a1 net'profit of- £72;000 pet annum.
Early applifiatioU will Bo’nmdo to the Egyptian Government, as reoommendod by Srf-Douglas’Pox '&1 Partners in’thelt report, for the extension of tho Nnbarieh Oanal to htigate1 the ■ Company’s lands with Nile water. 'Th6'Cotftf>any;has a 'reserVb of "100,000 Shares to provide further working capital, in ordet WsebbrS td this Company tho foil benefit of' anoh extension as soon as granted, and in the'meantime the land will continue to be cultivated with the wator of the existing^ vfolls and natural rainfall, supplemented by snob further wells as the Company's Engineers recommend.
Applications for official quotations for the Company’s Shares will be made to tho London Stock Exchange, and tho Bourses of Alexandria and Cairo. Copies of the Contracts and of thO' Report of Sir Douglas Fox and Partners and tho Memorandum and Articles of Association of the Company oan be seen at tho. Offioes of tho Company in Alexandria and at the Offioes of Maitre Carton de Wiart, Cairo, until the closing of the' lists, during business hoars.
Applications for shares to bo mado on the forms accompanying tho Proapeotus aud for- warded with the amount payable on application to tho Company's Bankers in Alexandria or Cairo. Failure to pay instalments when duo will render payments already made liable to forfeiture. Prospeotuses with forma of application can be obtained' from the Company’s Bankers and Brokers. the oomi of the C Subscriptions for shares will only riptiona for shares will only be rewired on tho applioation forms aooompanying proapeotus, oopioa of whioh may ba had on application to any of tire
